  1. Home
  2. Departments
  3. Municipal Court

If you received a citation inside the City of Hamilton, please read this information carefully. You must take action by the shown on your citation. Ignoring a citation can result in additional fees, a charge of Failure to Appear, and other consequences allowed by law.

This page applies to citations filed in the City of Hamilton Municipal Court .

  • Your citation and paperwork should list “City of Hamilton Municipal Court, 200 E. Main Street, Hamilton, TX 76531” .

If your citation was issued for an offense outside the Hamilton city limits , it is usually handled by the , not the City. Those citations are typically accompanied by a BLUE FORM (Justice Court) .

If your paperwork is blue, or if your citation lists the Justice Court of Hamilton County, please follow the instructions on that form and pay the , not the City’s online system. If you are unsure which court has your case, call (254) 386-1221 before making a payment.

  • Contact the Court by phone, email, or mail, or
  • May result in a conviction being reported as allowed by law.

You may be able to request a payment plan or other arrangements if you cannot pay the full amount at once. Contact the Court before your due date to discuss options.

To see if you qualify, contact the Municipal Court before your due date or review the form listed under Municipal Court forms.

You have the right to plead and request a trial before a Judge or a jury. To do this, follow the instructions on your citation paperwork or contact the Court before your appearance date. The Court will schedule a trial or pre-trial setting and provide further instructions.

  • Juveniles (under 17 years of age) are generally required by state law to appear in open court with a parent or legal guardian. Do pay a juvenile citation online unless the Court has specifically instructed you to do so.
  • Additional appearance requirements may apply for certain offenses (for example, some alcohol or tobacco violations by minors). Check your citation and paperwork carefully and contact the Court with any questions.

Pay My Citation Online

Make checks or money orders payable to the City of Hamilton . Do not mail cash. Mailed responses should be postmarked on or before your appearance date.

You may visit the Municipal Court window at City Hall during lobby hours to:

Step 5 – Contact information

200 E. Main Street Hamilton, TX 76531 Phone: (254) 386-8116, ext. 3 Fax: (254) 386-3508 Email: court@ci.hamilton.tx.us

If you are unsure what to do about your citation, please contact the Court . Court staff can explain your options and tell you which forms you may need, but they cannot give legal advice.
